experiencesList.title: PhD in Biochemistry
experiencesList.company: Department of Biology, University of Copenhagen (DIKU), Denmark
details: Thesis title: Computational Studies of Drug Resistance Investigating Binding Affinities and Structural Ensembles of Proteins

PhD fellow position with the Structural Biology and NMR group at the University of Copenhagen. Research focused on protein-drug interactions, drug resistance and development of software solutions for bridging experimental and theoretical analysis of protein ensembles.

experiencesList.title: Master of Science (Chemistry)
details: Thesis title: Computational Study of Electronic and Structural Properties of Molecular Species in Confined Spaces

“Confinement effects over the energetic profile of a Menshutkin S<sub>N</sub>2 reaction, a computational study”, under the tutelage of Dr. Alexandre Magalhães, involved studying the effect of confinement inside carbon nanotubes over a S<sub>N</sub>2 Menshutkin reaction. This project involved using ONIOM QM/MM, PCM and various other quantum methodologies.

experiencesList.title: Bachelor of Science (Chemistry)
details: Thesis title: Computational determination of the three-dimensional structures of important protein complexes involved in HIV-1 cellular entrance

Bachelor's degree, with the final research project on “Computational determination of the three-dimensional structures of important protein complexes involved in HIV-1 cellular entrance”. This project was developed with Dr. Irina Moreira and Dr. Maria João Ramos and involved extensive protein-ligand docking, protein-protein docking and various other structural bioinformatics methods.
